intro: Erigeron reductus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It produces small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, which bloom in the summer months. Erigeron reductus is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
